intro: Elytropus spectabilis, commonly known as the showy elytropus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-shaped clusters, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural reserves.
